text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/2ce14589f210dcb3d17d1d80285256f8ac10abab|patch 8.2.1598: starting a hidden terminal resizes the current window>
patch 8.2.1598: starting a hidden terminal resizes the current window

Problem:    Starting a hidden terminal resizes the current window.
Solution:   Do not resize the current window for a hidden terminal.
            (closes #6872)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1598: starting a hidden terminal resizes the current window · vim/vim@2ce1458
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1598: starting a hidden terminal resizes the current window · vim/vim@2ce1458
attachments.text: Problem: Starting a hidden terminal resizes the current window. Solution: Do not resize the current window for a hidden terminal. (closes #6872)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/8b5866ded6036f7adece26b6d16962bbd2d47842|patch 8.2.1597: the channel source file is too big>
patch 8.2.1597: the channel source file is too big

Problem:    The channel source file is too big.
Solution:   Move job related code to a new source file.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1597: the channel source file is too big · vim/vim@8b5866d
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1597: the channel source file is too big · vim/vim@8b5866d
attachments.text: Problem: The channel source file is too big. Solution: Move job related code to a new source file.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/7dfc5ce7cf4a7f63370d7dce2e13f7410ca0230a|patch 8.2.1596: using win_screenpos('.') in tests works but is wrong>
patch 8.2.1596: using win_screenpos('.') in tests works but is wrong

Problem:    Using win_screenpos('.') in tests works but is wrong.
Solution:   Use win_screenpos(0).

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1596: using win_screenpos('.') in tests works but is wrong · vim/vim@7dfc5ce
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1596: using win_screenpos('.') in tests works but is wrong · vim/vim@7dfc5ce
attachments.text: Problem: Using win_screenpos('.') in tests works but is wrong. Solution: Use win_screenpos(0).

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/86394aa9720c5e087d85831e42d44e042987fbc0|patch 8.2.1595: cannot easily see what Vim sends to the terminal>
patch 8.2.1595: cannot easily see what Vim sends to the terminal

Problem:    Cannot easily see what Vim sends to the terminal.
Solution:   Write output to the channel log if it contains terminal control
            sequences.  Avoid warnings for tputs() argument.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1595: cannot easily see what Vim sends to the terminal · vim/vim@86394aa
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1595: cannot easily see what Vim sends to the terminal · vim/vim@86394aa
attachments.text: Problem: Cannot easily see what Vim sends to the terminal. Solution: Write output to the channel log if it contains terminal control sequences. Avoid warnings for tputs() argument.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/cf8aa6448b3520905bea528ea8ad6533cbef288d|patch 8.2.1594: pull requests on github do not notify a maintainer>
patch 8.2.1594: pull requests on github do not notify a maintainer

Problem:    Pull requests on github do not notify a maintainer.
Solution:   Add a CODEOWNERS file with a few initial entries.

attachments.title: patch 8.2.1594: pull requests on github do not notify a maintainer · vim/vim@cf8aa64
attachments.text: Problem: Pull requests on github do not notify a maintainer. Solution: Add a CODEOWNERS file with a few initial entries.

patch 8.2.1592: Vim9: passing "true" to char2nr() fails

Problem:    Vim9: passing "true" to char2nr() fails.
Solution:   Use tv_get_bool_chk(). (closes #6865)

<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/b936b79424d435b83cdebed5507a9d3800e66e6c|patch 8.2.1589: term_start() options for size are overruled by 'termw…>
patch 8.2.1589: term_start() options for size are overruled by 'termwinsize'

Problem:    Term_start() options for size are overruled by 'termwinsize'.
            (Sergey Vlasov)
Solution:   Set 'termwinsize' to the specified size.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1589: term_start() options for size are overruled by 'termw… · vim/vim@b936b79
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1589: term_start() options for size are overruled by 'termw… · vim/vim@b936b79
attachments.text: …insize' Problem: Term_start() options for size are overruled by 'termwinsize'. (Sergey Vlasov) Solution: Set 'termwinsize' to the specified size.
